numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that an applicant is more likely to be admitted if the parents of the applicant are richer.
2. I notice that an applicant is 7 times more likely to be admitted if the parents of the applicant are richer.
3. I notice that a legacy applicant is almost consistently 2 times more likely to be admitted.
4. There is a large gap between the two lines.
5. I wonder why money matters to elite colleges.
6. All students pay the same tuition.
7. I wonder why these colleges are picky.
8. I wonder who the relatives of legacy students are.
9. A relative can be a parent.
10. A relative can be a grandparent.
11. A relative can be an aunt.
12. A relative can be an uncle.
14. My friends and I have to apply to colleges soon.
16. The headline is: Unfair biases in college admission?
